document.docAuthor: Rodriguez-Ramirez, Joanna, Beccacece, Hernan Mario, Pinheiro, Lívia Rodrigues, Grados, Juan & Morono-Brizuela, Maria Lucila
document.masterDocTitle: Type material of Arctiinae (Lepidoptera: Erebidae) in the collection of the Museo Argentino de Ciencias Naturales Bernardino Rivadavia (Buenos Aires Argentina)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Type material of Arctiinae (Lepidoptera: Erebidae) in the collection of the Museo Argentino de Ciencias Naturales Bernardino Rivadavia (Buenos Aires Argentina)

bibRefCitation.author: Berg, C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Berg, C. (1875) Lepidopteros Patagonicos observados en el viaje de 1874. Acta Academica Nacional de Cordova, 1 (4), 64 - 101.

bibRefCitation.author: Berg, C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Berg, C. (1875) Lepidopteros Patagonicos observados en el viaje de 1874. Acta Academica Nacional de Cordova, 1 (4), 64 - 101.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type Material. Male holotype . Type material possibly lost or destroyed.

Type locality and label information.
[ Argentina , BuenosAires , Muro del fuerte del Carm[en].[de] Patag[ones]].; [ Typus ]; [ 6.XII.1874 ]; [col. Berg]. (Information of locality from original description only).

MACN .
The type material of this species was not found in
MACN .

Remarks. The holotype was not found. The female of this species was painted in the catalogue of Hampson (1914 : plate XXXV, fig. 28), and the habitus matches with the description of the male holotype .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 25–28. Dorsal and ventral view of type specimens with its respective labels. 25, male holotype of
Mesolasia splendens Jörgensen, 1935
. 26, male paratype of
Phoenicoprocta schreiteri Jörgensen, 1935
. 27, possible male syntype of
Hypocrita calochroma Snellen, 1878
. 28, male holotype of
Cisthene australis Orfila, 1935
.

bibRefCitation.author: Burmeister, C. H. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Burmeister, C. H. C. (1878) Lepidopteres. Troisieme Tribu Lepidopteres de la Nuit. Description Physique de la Republique Argentine, 5, 363 - 518.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type Material. Undisclosed number of syntypes . Type material possibly lost or destroyed.

Type locality and label information.
[ Córdova , Argentina ] (information of locality from original description only)
.

MACN .
The type material of this species was not found in
MACN .
Remarks. Burmeister (1878) commented that the type specimens were from Córdov[b]a and obtained by M. Berg. The habitus of a male was painted in the catalogue of Hampson (1914 : plate XXVI, fig. 16).

bibRefCitation.author: Burmeister, C. H. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Burmeister, C. H. C. (1878) Lepidopteres. Troisieme Tribu Lepidopteres de la Nuit. Description Physique de la Republique Argentine, 5, 363 - 518.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type Material. Undisclosed number of syntypes . Material possible lost or destroyed.

Type locality and labels information.
[ Argentina , Buenos Aires ] (information of locality from original description only)
.

MACN .
The males syntypes were not found at
MACN .
Remarks. A syntype was illustrated separately from the original description by the author ( Burmeister 1880 : Atlas, XVII, Fig. 16 ). The species is not rare in Buenos Aires ( Burmeister 1878 ).

bibRefCitation.author: Snellen, P. C. T.
bibRefCitation.refString: Snellen, P. C. T. (1878) Description de deux nouvelles especes de Lepidopteres Heteroceres appartenant a la familie des Lithosides. Boletin de la Academia Nacional de Ciencias, 2, 390 - 392.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type Material. Three male syntypes .

Type locality and label information. Label of the possible syntypes : “[ Argentina ], Buenos Aires ”;
“ Hypocrita Hb. 1816 H.S.
”; “
calochroma Snell
[en]. R [epública]. A[rgentina].”; “ SYNTYPE ”; “MACN-En 33536” (new catalogue number of Aurora).

MACN .
Two possible syntypes were found at
MACN .

Remarks. We cannot confirm if these two specimens are two of the three syntypes used by Snellen (1878) in the original description. Snellen (1878) only commented that this species is common in Córdov[b]a, [ Argentina ], but he did not mention if all syntypes are from the same type locality. Hampson (1900) commented that one male type is deposited in Collection Snellen.
Type Material. Male holotype . Material possible lost or destroyed.

Type locality and label information.
[ Paraguay , San Bernardino ], [ ♂ ], [diciembre, 1935] (information of lo- cality from original description only)
.

MACN .
The type material of this species was not found in
MACN .

Remarks. Jörgensen (1935) commented that the specimen flew in December after emerging from the pupa. For this reason, we presumably consider that the specimen was observed, but not collected. The specimen is similar to the typical form but the color of the head and patagia are different. As there is no genus of Lepidoptera named
Bulbura
, we considered it as a misspelled name.

bibRefCitation.author: Jorgensen, P.
bibRefCitation.refString: Jorgensen, P. (1935) Lepidopteros nuevos o raros de la Argentina y del Paraguay. Anales Museo Nacional de Historia Natural de Buenos Aires, 38, 85 - 130.

bibRefCitation.author: Jorgensen, P.
bibRefCitation.refString: Jorgensen, P. (1935) Lepidopteros nuevos o raros de la Argentina y del Paraguay. Anales Museo Nacional de Historia Natural de Buenos Aires, 38, 85 - 130.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type Material. Undisclosed number of female syntypes , possibly lost or destroyed.

Type locality and label information.
[ Paraguay , Villarrica ], [ ♀ ], [marzo] (information of locality and sex from original description only)
.

MACN .
The syntypes were not found at
MACN .

Remarks. Jörgensen (1935) did not mention where the type material was deposited. This species is very similar to
Odozana patagiata Dognin, 1909
from Bolivia ( Jörgensen 1935 ). The latter was painted in the catalogue of Hampson (1914 : plate XXXV, figure 4).

bibRefCitation.author: Orfila, R. N.
bibRefCitation.refString: Orfila, R. N. (1935) Lepidoptera Neotropica. II. Dos nuevas especies de Noctuoidea. Revista de la Sociedad Entomologica Argentina, 7, 225 - 226.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type Material. Male holotype and a female allotypus ( paratype ).

Type locality and label information: Male holotype with the following labels: “Sierras de Tandil, [Provincia de] Buenos Aires , [República] Argentina , 7-XII-[1]930; A. Breyer leg[acy].”; “ HOLOTYPUS ”; “
Eudesmia australis
n[ew]. sp[ecies]., DET[ermined]. ORFILA; “
Vianania australis
♂ Holotypus Orfila”; “MACN-En 32204” (new catalogue number of Aurora). Female paratype with the following labels: “Sierras de Tandil, [Provincia de] Buenos Aires , [República] Argentina , 7-XII-[1]930, Alb. Breyer leg[acy].”; “ ALLOTYPUS ”; “
Eudesmia australis
n[ew]. sp[ecies]., DET[ermined]. ORFILA”; “ PARATYPUS ”; “
Vianania australis ♀ Allotypus Orfila
”; “MACN- En 32205” (new catalogue number of Aurora).

MACN .
The holotype
is in moderate to bad condition because the antennae and abdomen were dissected. Paratype in similar condition to that of holotype .
Remarks. There are other eight paratypes deposited in the Museo La Plata. All preparations made by Orfila were found at MACN.

bibRefCitation.author: Forster, W.
bibRefCitation.refString: Forster, W. (1942) Eine neue Lithosiidae (Lep. Arct.) aus Bolivien. Entomologische Zeitschrift Frankfurt a. M., 56, 41 - 42.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type Material. Male paratype .

Type locality and label information. Male paratype with the following labels: “Zoolog[ische]. Staatss[amm]l[un]g, BOLIVIA , [Province Sud] Yungas, [Department La Paz ], Chulumani, 1500-2000 m [eters], leg[acy]. Schulze”; “Genitales p[reparation]. m. n[umber] 673”; “ PARATYPUS ”; “Para-typus ♂ ,
Cisthene boliviana Forst [er].
, W. Forster München”; “MACN-En 33534” (new catalogue number of Aurora).

MACN .
A male paratype was found in bad condition without left antenna and abdomen
.

Remarks. Surely, Orfila (1954) used this specimen to compare it and describe with the type specimen of
Vianania aymara Orfila, 1954
. The preparation made by Orfila was found at MACN. The habitus of this species is very similar to the habitus of some species included in
Cisthene Walker, 1854
and
Vianania Orfila, 1954
. It is necessary to review these two genera and
Eucyclopera Hampson, 1895
.

bibRefCitation.author: Orfila, R. N.
bibRefCitation.refString: Orfila, R. N. (1954) Notas sobre Lithosiidae: (Lepid.) I. El genero Eudesmia Hb. y un genero y especie nuevos. Physis, 20, 474 - 486.

bibRefCitation.author: Orfila, R. N.
bibRefCitation.refString: Orfila, R. N. (1954) Notas sobre Lithosiidae: (Lepid.) I. El genero Eudesmia Hb. y un genero y especie nuevos. Physis, 20, 474 - 486.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type Material. Male holotype and male paratype .

Type locality and label information . Male holotype with the following labels: “ HOLOTYPUS ”; “Coll[ection]. ORFILA”, Bolivia , Cochabamba , 2600 m ., Zischka [leg.], 8-I-[19]49”; [ ♂ ]; “MACN-En 33535” (new catalogue number of Aurora). Male paratype with the following labels: [ Paratypus ], [ ♂ ], [ Bolivia , Sara] (information of locali- ties from original description only).

MACN .
The holotype is in bad condition and the paratype was not found in
MACN .

Remarks. Orfila (1954) mentioned that type materials were deposited in his own collection. Surely, Orfila used the Forster’s specimen to compare it and describe with the type specimen of
Vianania aymara Orfila, 1954
. The preparations made by Orfila were found at MACN.
